chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
R: relation X

Goal:
forall x y z : X, star R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z

Premises:
star : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X
relation = fun X : Type => relation2 X X : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
star_S : forall x y z : X, star R x y -> R y z -> star R x z
star_sind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> SProp), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
star_ind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> Prop), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
S_star : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (y x z : X), R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z
star1 : forall x y : X, R x y -> star R x y
Relation_Operators.clos_trans_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (P : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> P x y) -> (forall x y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> P x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x a : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x a -> P x a
Inductive clos_trans (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y | t_trans : forall y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_trans _%type_scope
star_refl : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (x : X), star R x x
Ring_theory.Rmul_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)
Ring_theory.Radd_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z)
Ring_theory.mk_art : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), (forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x) -> (forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z)) -> (forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x) -> (forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO) -> (forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)) ->...-> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req
Ring_theory.Rdistr_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd x y) z) (radd (rmul x z) (rmul y z))
Record ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_rt { Radd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; Radd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); Radd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); Rmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; Rmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); Rmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z); Rdistr_l : forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd...
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul...
Ring_theory.Rmul_comm : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x)
Ring_theory.Radd_comm : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x)
Ring_theory.Rsub_def : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (rsub x y) (radd x (ropp y))
Ring_theory.Ropp_mul_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (ropp (rmul x y)) (rmul (ropp x) y)
Ring_theory.Ropp_add : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (ropp (radd x y)) (radd (ropp x) (ropp y))
Ring_theory.morph_eq : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall x y : C, ceqb x y = true -> req (phi x) (phi y)
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x :...
PreOmega.Z.rem_bound_pos_pos : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 y -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 x -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.rem x y) /\ BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.rem x y) y
Ring_theory.Radd_0_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x
Ring_theory.Rmul_1_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x
Ring_theory.ARmul_1_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x
PreOmega.Z.rem_bound_pos_neg : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 y -> BinInt.Z.le x BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.opp y) (BinInt.Z.rem x y) /\ BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.rem x y) BinNums.Z0
Ring_polynom.mkmult_rec_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall mkmult_pow : R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R, (forall (r x : R) (p : BinNums.positive), req (mkmult_pow r x p) (rmul r (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul x p))) -> forall (lm : list (R * BinNums.positive)) (r : R), req (Ring_polynom.mkmult_rec mkmult_pow r lm) (rmul r (Ring_polynom.r_list_pow rI rmul lm))
rew_sigT2 : forall (Q R0 : forall a : ?A, ?P a -> Prop) (u : {p : ?P ?x & Q ?x p & R0 ?x p}) (y : ?A) (H : ?x = y), eq_rect ?x (fun a : ?A => {p : ?P a & Q a p & R0 a p}) u y H = existT2 (Q y) (R0 y) (eq_rect ?x ?P (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) y H) match H as x in (_ = a) return (Q a (eq_rect ?x ?P (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) a x)) with | eq_refl => projT2 (sigT_of_sigT2 u) end match H as x in (_ = a) return (R0 a (eq_rect ?x ?P (projT1 (sigT_of_sigT2 u)) a x)) with | eq_refl => projT3...
Ring_polynom.mkmult1_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (mkpow : R -> BinNums.positive -> R) (mkmult_pow : R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R), (forall (r : R) (p : BinNums.positive), req (mkpow r p) (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul r p)) ->...-> forall lm : list (R * BinNums.positive), req (Ring_polynom.mkmult1 rI mkpow mkmult_pow lm) (Ring_polynom.r_list_pow rI rmul lm)
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
